content:
I've tested-deployed here "Recent Topics", a prototype feature in #15064 available via the t hotkey or this clock in the left sidebar:
image.png. It's a different form of view showing recent message history, and is a candidate to replace Zulip's default center pane view ("All messages" would still be available, but no longer where you land when you load Zulip). Huge thanks to @Aman Agrawal for working on this.

We'd love feedback on all aspects of the user experience around this. My current thinking is to merge it to master after a bit more work on the implementation as something only accessible via the t hotkey to make it easier to integrate on the details, before making it more available. (I would probably plan to make it an item like "Mentions" in the top-left navigation rather than the current "clock" widget for opening it).
One thing I notice is that the hover styling doesn't support the night theme :slight_smile:
I feel like the sort order should reflect how recently I've visited a topic. (or it should be an option to sort them that way)
image.png
I don't how helpful that traceback is, but when I entered the dialog the 3rd or 4th times, the buttons stopped working for me, which I assume is related to the above.
Is filtering supposed to match on topic names? It just seems broken to me (after I reloaded, and no tracebacks since then).
Screenshot_2.png
The buttons and the time isn't visible when highlighted.

Vinit Singh said:

The buttons and the time isn't visible when highlighted.

Just to add a little note to make this easier to find, this seems like a night mode bug. It's pretty legible in day mode with the highlight.
The (unhighlighted) blue text was almost un-readable in night mode when my screen's brightness was a little low.

Just got a different traceback (and it's breaking my unread counts):

image.png
As mentioned in #issues > webapp lag, I'm seeing severe performance problems when visiting a topic via this feature and when first loading czo.
(Loving the potential of this feature)
Also seeing a whole bunch of broken avatar images with 400s and 414s
It also feels kind of funny that mark as read seemingly removes the topic from the list?
You must have 'unread' filter on.

Oh now seeing

So, the avatars are lagging for me everywhere.
Oh I do now! But it was so delayed after clicking I thought those were just non-functional at the moment.

And nothing is visible.

Looks like message_store.get(topic.last_msg_id) is returning undefined.
@Steve Howell @Tim Abbott are all the fetched messages not stored in message_store?

function format_topic(topic_data) {
    const last_msg = message_store.get(topic_data.last_msg_id);
    const stream = last_msg.stream;
    const stream_id = last_msg.stream_id;
This is the part of the function which is failing.
I think all fetched messages go into the message store pretty much as soon as we see them
There are some gotchas like local echo making temporary ids.

Aman Agrawal said:

So, the avatars are lagging for me everywhere.

I'm seeing this as well.

So, the issue with avatars is

The s=50 symptom seems like some things are happening inside loops that should be happening outside loops. I am sorta skeptical that this is exposing any weaknesses in our existing libraries. #15064
We generally want to avoid patching stuff onto people objects. It’s cheap to make shallow copies of objects when we need fuller objects with a few extra fields for the templates.
Yeah, makes more sense.

sounds good to me.

I was waiting to see feedback on this. Right now, we only hide muted topics and not muted streams. So, you will see topics from muted streams also. Steve Howell thoughts on this?

I think this one is debatable. Personally I'd be fine if we excluded muted streams here. I think I would generally continue to catch up muted streams using the left sidebar.
I personally prefer not showing the topics from muted stream as well. Right now I have a lot of noise from muted streams in recent topics modal.
I'd say it shouldn't show anything muted per default. There's a reason I muted, right. I think a filter would be nice?
Yup. That makes sense. We have enough space to add a filter.
Great! Thanks everyone. I will add a filter for this. So, just to be clear. When "Muted" filter is on, you will be able to see your muted streams/topics.

Okay. I will see how easily it can be done. (I am currently busy writing tests for the performance improvements and bugfixes I did today)
I pushed features and bugfixes requested in today's discussion.
Have we made progress on the performance issues?
Yes, other than list_render I think I implemented all of the them.

Tim said: We'd love feedback on all aspects of the user experience around this.

Is a great option, I have a proposition you might want to consider (see attached mockup):

  • if you are in a stream and hit t to display topics with unread messages under current stream and the rest of the streams collapsed (but expandable if you click the bar)
  • If you are in All messages then hitting t will show all streams with all unread topics expanded (like is now but organised by streams)
    Alternative: all streams show all topics (like now), one stream selected will show only that stream unread topics.

Having them organised by streams will remove stream name in front of each topic thus easy on the eye. However it will break the chronological display of messages (all streams) paradigm but will expand more on Zupip point of difference: information organised by streams and topics.
This is useful if you just want to see what is new in a stream or look for a topic you forgot the name (so is difficult to search it)

In my attached mockup first stream bar is collapsed and hitting on the bar will display unread topics in that stream.
Rest of the streams are expanded.
I am not a graphic design person so please go gentle on me :slight_smile: unread-topics.png
Yeah, I'm not sure precisely how we want to do it, but we'll want to prioritize unread messages in either this or a related view.

@Eugenol Man thank for the great idea! This view will be removed as popup and be presented as narrow. So, the concept opening this in a stream isn't there. We will set "Unread" filter as default anyway in future (with or without participated filter) which can be opened using t. We can add another hotkey T (capital t) to filter the topics according to the last open stream. Which would be as simple as setting the search_text = stream_name. (or a little more complicated than that, it matches topic names too)
The concept of grouping is definitely interesting and easy on the eyes, we might iterate on it in future.
@Tim Abbott updated the PR which now uses list_render and few css tweaks.
(deleted)
